intro: Pleuteron tenuis, commonly known as the slender pleuteron, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical structure includes opposite leaf arrangement and stipules at the base of each leaf. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
